qas.question: What place is Catalan named for?
What type of language is Catalan?
What is Catalan called in Valencia?
Where is Catalan the only official language?

context: Catalan (/ˈkætəlæn/; autonym: català [kətəˈla] or [kataˈla]) is a <a1_0>Romance language<a1_0/> named for its origins in <a0_0>Catalonia<a0_0/>, in what is northeastern Spain and adjoining parts of France. It is the national and only official language of <a3_0>Andorra<a3_0/>, and a co-official language of the Spanish autonomous communities of Catalonia, the Balearic Islands, and Valencia (where the language is known as <a2_0>Valencian<a2_0/>, and there exist regional standards). It also has semi-official status in the city of Alghero on the Italian island of Sardinia. It is also spoken with no official recognition in parts of the Spanish autonomous communities of Aragon (La Franja) and Murcia (Carche), and in the historic French region of Roussillon/Northern Catalonia, roughly equivalent to the department of Pyrénées-Orientales.
